The story of the game changes directions pretty quick. The developers clearly wanted the story to be about Elizabeth and the city of Columbia, but then they changed their minds and it becomes about multiverse and metaphysical reality. I presume that they wanted to make the game story interesting, but I feel like it ended up being a cheap twist. It would have been better if it was just save Elizabeth, beat the main villain and just go home. Instead of "woah, there are multiple universes, but in every universe there is a light house and it is all connected somehow". 
I also didn't like the combat in this game, maps feel pretty small in comparison with how it shows in the trailer. That's one other thing too, is that the game isn't what you would expect from the trailers. They definitely took things out during the production to make way for the big twists. I would say that the trailers were the best part of this game.

Buenísimo y con una historia y DLCs súper interesantes que conectan con Bioshock 1 y 2. Es algo distinto a las entregas anteriores en algunos aspectos. Por ejemplo no hay mapa y algunos enfrentamientos tienen lugar en zonas muy abiertas. Da una falsa sensación de libertad ya que en verdad es un shooter bastante lineal, salvo por que hay algunas zonas escondidas lo cual le confiere algo de exploración, pero creo que las primeras entregas destacaban más en eso. Este juego destaca por su acción desenfrenada ya que enfrentas a grandes grupos de enemigos, y en su historia (si es mejor o peor que las anteriores es subjetivo, para mí el 1 es mejor y después vendría éste). El arsenal es similar y los plásmidos, llamados vigorizantes en ésta entrega, son parecidos a los ya vistos en los otros juegos. Imprescindible si has disfrutado de los otros Bioshock.

初中的时候在《电脑爱好者》杂志上看到过这个游戏的推荐，已经是快10年前的事情了。疫情隔离期间很无聊，冲着蒸汽朋克这个标签玩了玩这个游戏，玩上头了，一玩就是三个小时。钩锁的操作太爽了，有种骑着立体机动装置飞行的感觉。印象最深战斗的就是登上第一夫人飞艇前跟前来拦截的小飞艇战斗，敌人和我都在滑轨上穿梭，眼花缭乱。场景美术非常厉害，即使是上个十年的游戏，我依然能感受到天空之城哥伦比亚那泡影般的浪漫。

I recently beat the Bioshock trilogy (including all the DLC) for the very first time, so I have NO nostalgia goggles or bias. Here is my short summery of each game in the series:

Bioshock Infinite: Easily the most visually impressive game of the series in terms of art style & aesthetic, it's an absolute treat for the eyes and very immersive. The downside of this however is it paces a lot slower than the first 2 games and the default difficulty setting was stupidly easy, I didn't die until the last part of the game! It has the most creative enemy design of the game; Firemen, Zealots, Handymen and the Mechanized Patriots, which I thought was awesome. Sky hook combat was really fun. The story goes from a fever dream into a full blown acid trip, which is a bit hard to follow at times. I did enjoy the ending however, as I love a dark twist! DLC "Burial at Sea" was a great way to tie the trilogy together, the best part was experiencing Rapture before it becomes a giant meth den. You get to work with mad artist Sander Cohen, who was a brilliantly written villain from the first game. I also enjoyed the switchup with forced stealth gameplay from controlling Elizabeth. Overall a very impressive game to complete the series but I still think I enjoyed 2 the most. Only one glitch in this game but it was a frustrating one, I spawned into the floor of an elevator and couldn't progress or even reload an old save without it happening again. Found a weird solution through some old forums from back in 2015.

Bioshock: Most interesting characters of the series, mainly the villains (if you don't count some of them being reintroduced in the Infinite DLC). Game paces very well, short immersion into the world then straight into the action, loads you up with intuitive weps / powers as you go through. Level design was very well thought out. Final boss was a cool idea but way too easy which was kind of an anti climax. Remastered game crashed on me once and I also had a really annoying glitch involving the camera tool where an enemy didn't spawn and I couldn't progress any further. Google searched the glitch and found out it was a known issue (how the hell has this not been patched yet, in 2022?!?) I had to restart the whole chapter which was a massive waste of time.

Bioshock 2: The best game in the series IMO. Firstly, you get to play as a big daddy with charge drill. The default difficulty is way more ramped up than Bioshock 1, which is good because the first game was way too easy. The enemies will quickly overwhelm you and gun you down so you're forced to use the wide variety of weapon, plasmid, trap or environmental combos. The "protect the little sister while she harvests" element forces you into vulnerable situations where you have to use all these tricks to defend, bolt tripwires / plasmid traps etc instead of just running through each map blasting through everything like the first game. The "Big Sister" stalking you is also a thrilling element for the same reasons. The game also includes sections where you're hulking around on the ocean floor outside of Rapture, which I thought was really immersive. The DLC "Minerva's Den" was incredible, might even be my most enjoyable part of the game series. Remastered edition crashed on me twice so be prepared to do a lot of quicksaves.
对于海葬二部曲结局不是很满意，感觉伊丽莎白白忙活还搭上了自己小命，对游戏整体满意

Overrated game.
The plot is nothing special. Multiverse plots overall are one of the cheapest sci-fi plots out there. The plot and ending is the same every time, no matter what you choose in what little choices there are. For a multiverse game and for a Bioshock game that is a missed opportunity. However I liked the part where they learned how to control the Songbird. The clue was very clever. 
Plasmi-- apologies-- Vigors are poorly explained. Where in Bioshock 1 and 2 Plasmids were integral part of the plot, in Infinite Vigors only exist, because it wouldn't be a Bioshock game without. The first time Vigors are introduced, the main character doesn't even question that maybe drinking a bottle of mysterious (and potentially poisonous) liquid found laying around might not be a good idea. I mean you either get super powers, get drunk, or die, a win-win-win situation. And, as mentioned previously, there are no moral decisions you have to make to acquire the fuel to use the powers. No "should I kill this little girl and get all of the juice, or spare her but only get little" choice. You just get it from the recharge station.
As a gameplay mechanic, Elisabeth is completely unnecessary. Her job is to pick locks and scour up ammo and health pickups, nothing that the player shouldn't be able to do themselves. There were times when she refused to pick locks, because she "was busy", just standing there.

Yliarvostettu peli.
Tarina ei ole mitään erikoista. Multiversumi-tarinat ovat muutenkin yleensä halvimpia tieteistarinoita. Juoni ja loppu ovat samat, valitsi sitten mitä tahansa niissä muutamissa valinnoissa. Multiversumi-peliksi ja Bioshock-peliksi tämä on hukattu mahdollisuus. Tosin pidin kohdasta, jossa päähenkilö oppii ohjaamaan Laululintua. Johtolangat olivat hyvin ovelia.
Plasi-- anteeksi-- Vigorit on huonosti selitetty. Siinä missä Plasmidit olivat Bioshock 1:ssä ja 2:ssa oleellinen osa tarinaa, Infiniten Vigorit ovat olemassa vain, koska mitä olisi Bioshock ilman. Ensimmäisen kerran kun Vigorit esiintyvät, päähenkilö ei edes kyseenalaista, että oudon (ja kenties myrkillisen) litkun kulauttaminen kurkusta alas ei ehkä ole paras mahdollinen ajatus. Sitä joko saa supervoimat, itsensä humalaan tai heittää henkensä, voittoa joka tapauksessa. Lisäksi, kuten jo mainittu, ei ole minkäänlaista moraalista dilemmaa polttoaineen saamiseksi. Ei "Tappaisinko pienen tytön saadakseni kaikki mehut, vai säästäisinkö hänet ja saisin vain vähän" vaihtoehtoa. Sitä vain saa latausasemalta.
Pelillisesti Elisabet on täysin turha. Hänen tehtäväkseen jää tiirikoida lukkoja ja kerätä ammuksia ja muita tarvikkeita. Kaiken pystyisi pelaajakin hyvin tekemään itse. Varsinkin kun moneen kertaan hän kieltäytyi tiirikoimasta lukkoa, koska oli "kiireinen" seistessään paikoillaan.

Finally completed it a few months ago, including Burial at Sea. Beautiful graphics that had no problem running at 60fps. Use a big screen, it's just that good. 

It's very different compared to Rapture but still a beautiful story nonetheless. It's breathtaking for the visuals. The worlds are very immersive but there's not a lot to explore in terms of worldbuilding via Voxophone, or doing different quests that forces you to learn more about the world around you. 

I'm glad this game took on a view of, "All political factions are screwed up." You get to punch the triple K, the countrymen, and use the railing however you'd like. 

Elizabeth and Booker deserved better. The DLC broke me at the end, but at least Elizabeth and Booker went to Paris in an alternate timeline... right??? Right??

前面四分之一恢弘大气，虽然也是单线剧情，但是场景宏大。自从遇到伊丽莎白，场景开始变得狭小，而且不断的战斗和不断的做任务，冗长又无聊。最后的结局反转只能说是通过剧情把游戏拔高了一下。但不论如何，遇到伊丽莎白后的游戏剧情让人玩着很沮丧，不断折返和打杀，一个简单的故事线通过战斗延长了十多个小时，莫不如直接做成爽快的FPS游戏。

Oyun kesinlikle çok güzel ama bazı eksikleri var. Öncelikle atmosfer ve karakterler ayakta alkışlanacak kadar iyi. BioShock'u BioShock yapan hikaye bu oyunda da çok iyi ama fazla geniş olduğundan hikayeyi çok iyi anlatamıyor. Oyunun sonu gerçekten etkileyici, gördüğüm en iyi 3 sondan biri desem abartmış olmam. Oynanış güzel ama bazı yerlerde biraz eksik hissettirebiliyor. Grafikler ve animasyonlar gerçekten çok iyi. Genel olarak oynadığım en iyi 5 FPS oyununa kesinlikle girer ama bence ilk oyunu geçemez.

[h1]First it was a city underwater, now it is a city in the sky[/h1] 

[u]What I liked about the game [/u]
[list]
[*]	I liked the steampunk floating city of Columbia. I really liked the time period in which the game takes place in. I like that you get to see city alive before it all goes to shit. 

[*]	I really enjoyed the story. It might take a couple of play-throughs to fully understand. I like that the game explores concepts like religion, race, science, and the multiverse theory.

[*]	Awesome soundtrack. I like how the people of Columbia have heard these songs from the future through these tears and decided to do their own version.  

[*]	A nice selection of weapons from the time period. It’s a shame they didn’t add more. The weapons are also satisfying to use, especially the shotgun. 

[*]	Awesome enemies like the motorized-patriot, the handy-man, and the fireman.  

[*]	I like some the new things they added like the sky-lines. I like how you can bring allies in using tears. 
[*]	Plenty of collectables like voxaphones and kinetoscopes. 

[*]	Interesting characters, like Elizabeth, Comstock, and Flint. 

[*]	Throughout the game you will be using vigor’s in combat, which are basically plasmids. There are some pretty cool ones, like Bucking-bronco, shock Jockey, and procession.  

[u]What I disliked or was disappointed with[/u]
 
[*]	You are unable to revisit areas like you could in the first Bioshock.  

[*]	It’s a shame you can’t see those modifications you purchase for your weapons.

[*]	It’s lacking those scary moments which you got in the first Bioshock game. 

[*]	 There’s no research camera or inventing machine. 

[*]	I wasn’t keen on the vox populi version of the weapons. There’s only one ammo type for each weapon. 

[*]	I wish the game had more memorable psychos. I remember in the first Bioshock you had these awesome psychos like Dr Steinman and Sander Cohen. 

[*]	I wasn’t keen on the idea of picking up clothes which had different perks. I much preferred the tonics from the first game. It would have been a nice to see what the clothes look like. 
[/list]
[u]Conclusion[/u]
 
I really enjoyed the story of Bioshock infinite; I prefer it to the original game. I liked the floating city of Columbia and the time period the game takes place in. I thought combat wasn’t as good as the previous games, but it was still good. The soundtrack is amazing.  It’s a shame the game didn’t have more gameplay features like the inventing machine, or research camera. The game is also lacking those memorable psychopaths the first game had. If you enjoyed playing the previous games or you like similar games like Prey or System Shock, then I highly recommend you play this game.   


[h1]9/10[/h1]
